solution.text:
Surface area of box \(=6 \times side^2\)
\(=6 \times _{{j*5}}_^2\)
\(=_{{6*j*j*25}}_cm^2\)
Additional material required for overlapping \(=_{k}_\)% of surface area of the box\(=_{{k/Decimal(100)}}_ \times _{{6*j*j*25}}_=_{{(k/Decimal(100))*(6*j*j*25)}}_cm^2\)
Quantity of cardboard required for a single box\(=_{{6*j*j*25}}_+_{{(k/Decimal(100))*(6*j*j*25)}}_=_{{(6*j*j*25)+((k/Decimal(100))*(6*j*j*25))}}_cm^2\)
Therefore, quantity of cardboard required for \(_{l}_\) boxes \(=_{l}_ \times _{{(6*j*j*25)+((k/Decimal(100))*(6*j*j*25))}}_=_{{l*((6*j*j*25)+((k/Decimal(100))*(6*j*j*25)))}}_cm^2\)
Dividing total quantity by \(10000\),
\(_{{l*((6*j*j*25)+((k/Decimal(100))*(6*j*j*25)))}}_cm^2=_{{(l/Decimal(10000))*((6*j*j*25)+((k/Decimal(100))*(6*j*j*25)))}}_m^2\)
Therefore, cost of cardboard required for supplying \(_{l}_\) boxes is \(_{{(l/Decimal(10000))*((6*j*j*25)+((k/Decimal(100))*(6*j*j*25)))}}_ \times 450=_{{((l*450)/Decimal(10000))*((6*j*j*25)+((k/Decimal(100))*(6*j*j*25)))}}_\)rupees

content.text:
A computer manufacturing company wants to place an order for making cardboard boxes for packing their computers. The box is in the form of a cube of side \(_{{j*5}}_\)cm. For all overlaps, \(_{k}_\)% of the total surface area is required extra.
If the cost of cardboard is Rs.\(450\) per sq.m., find the cost of cardboard required for supplying \(_{l}_\) boxes of the same kind.
